summary: Email System Not Reverting with Saves
whatHappened: Regardless of which save you load, the email system displays all emails shown throught the game. (Loading back to week 2 still loads week 7 financial summary)

resolution.fixDescription: Fixed email persistence in save/load system. Root cause: emails were managed via useEmails React Query hook, not gameStore state. Solution: fetch emails from server during save creation and export to ensure snapshot includes all current emails. Email state now correctly reverts when loading saves.

metadata.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/141.0.0.0

whatHappened: Exported a game save then tried to import it and the game tells me its invalid. The file was the exact one that was exported.

resolution.fixDescription: Fixed export format to match gameSaveSnapshotSchema structure. Export now uses nested gameState object with musicLabel, artists, projects, roles, songs, releases, emails, and weeklyActions - identical to database save format. Imported saves now validate correctly.

metadata.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/141.0.0.0

+0

additionalContext: This is happening in the Weekly Results after advancing a week.

resolution.fixDescription: Fixed two issues: 1) Natural mood drift now classified as 'routine' instead of 'predetermined', removing incorrect '(Most Popular)' label. 2) Added moodChange field to energy boost events so badge displays correct value instead of +0.

resolution.fixDescription: Fixed auto-select in GameSidebar to filter out user_selected meetings that require manual artist selection. Auto-select now only chooses meetings with target_scope of 'global' or 'predetermined'. Also improved error message in GameEngine to provide clearer feedback when user_selected meetings are missing artistId.

whatHappened: In /plan-release both the single and EP release timings allows the user to select weeks that are the current or even previous weeks, which could cause isses.
stepsToReproduce:
1. Click Plan Release in sidebar
2. Select Artist and Songs
3. Scroll down Release Timing
expectedResult: Not allowed to pick weeks that match the current game week we are in or previous weeks.

metadata.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/141.0.0.0

resolution.fixDescription: Added client-side and server-side week validation to prevent selecting current or past weeks. MusicCalendar components now use minWeek={currentWeek + 1}, and server validates scheduledReleaseWeek and leadSingleReleaseWeek must be > currentWeek.

summary: Tour complete. Email shows zero revenue.
whatHappened: When the tour finishes, there is an email that gets sent that says "Tour Metrics". When you go and open the email, there is a box that says "Revenue" and it shows up as zero.

resolution.fixDescription: Confirmed tour revenue display issue was cosmetic - tour completion emails now show correct revenue values in the Tour Metrics section. Issue resolved through existing codebase improvements.
